comments.comment: Service is responsible for some evaluation of a leave request - but it should not be responsible for generating any tasks.

comments.author: Rob Say
comments.comment: Confusing Service name - service is used to determine whether availablity can be automatically calculated and accepted ... manual check is a downstream event AutomatedAvailabilityEvaluationService ?

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment:
Hi Rob. Actually this service is not checking if availability can be calculated or not. It is just to determine if any manual followup checks are required irrerespective of availability is calculated. Hence name indicated that During Auto Evaluation of Avaliablity, is any manual follow up checks are to be done. Hence named accordingly.
Let me know if you agree with justification and name of service

comments.author: Rob Say
comments.comment: The Process did this for you for free with description set by event

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: We have to populate the description of the Task with Formatted List of Manual Checks to be done for Leave Request. Hence the Description of Task is created dynamically.

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-5026: Add MinimumTimeIncrement Check to AutoApproved Time Requests.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Do we have any specific reason why we used BigDecimal here? I suupose it would be sufficient to use long.
The same applies in evaluateMinimimumTimeIncrementOnAutoDecision(..) method.

comments.author: Mark Kevitt
comments.comment: There are two minimum time increments, one on LeavePlan and the other on ServiceAgreement. One is a BigDecimal and the other is a Long. I chose BigDecimal as there are more mathematical comparison methods available.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: I still think that this can be corrected if not done yet.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
1. We should not set Denied to all.
As per our logic in the mail, we should only set to Deny those which were set to Allowed. Also imagine the case where all the days could have been pending due to no work schedule, in that case we "should not" change them to Denied and "should not" change the reason to MTI not met.
2. It is good to call out Decision Days where ever it is realted to that. Days is understandable, but in the long run "Decision Day" would make it more clear for a new person.

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-1987:Nightly Failed,Refactor Leave Plan Decision Recording Failed Tests

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Update menuItem variable name to follow change of caption. i.e. it should now be called denyAbsenceCase, not declineAbsenceCase

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Is there not a method createActiveAbsenceManagementServiceAgreement, rather then changing a pending one and manuall moving it from pending -> review -> active?

comments.author: Priti Mahajan
comments.comment: createActiveAbsenceManagementServiceAgreement not used here because in that method we are creating two leave plans which is not requirement of this test.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Comment doesnt seem to make sense, we are assuming the employer leave plan DTO has an eligibilty exception? Is that safe to do? What if it was changed to have 2 exceptions (or none) - wouldnt this fail?

comments.author: Priti Mahajan
comments.comment: Actualy Exceptions are set True in Eligibility DTO so while creating employer leave plan we are applying eligibility execption, to verify if exceptions gets run on wrap up & to check related details for eligibility exception.For this particular test we required Eligibility status as Met, and we do not want exception to run as it has by default status Not known,so deleting same.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Same comments as above. Lots of code duplication here with evaluateLeavePlan - can we not have methods to do some of grunt work to make this easier to follow?

comments.author: Priti Mahajan
comments.comment: For Eligibility we have same reason above. For repeated code, seperate private method is created.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Same as above

comments.author: Priti Mahajan
comments.comment: For repeated code, seperate private method is created.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Same as above

comments.author: Priti Mahajan
comments.comment: Same reason as above.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: Is this code about eligibility needed ? I've ran a few of the tests without it and they pass

comments.author: Priti Mahajan
comments.comment: This code is requirede to edit leave plan eligibility to get the overall eligibility status Met to test leave plan adjudication.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
I wouldn't be completely happy with these private methods in tests. They tend to cause trouble when it comes to refactoring.
For instance, creating person, adding occupation and then the absence case and intake are in many tests at this stage. It would be better to have a method that performs these steps, if there is not already one, and all the tests could use it - worth checking anyway.
Also, after looking at the test, could you not have included all code under the 'Given' in this method - the only difference I see is the setting of plan decision in one of them and this could be done before the 'new bigger' method is called..
Give me a shout if you need.

comments.author: Priti Mahajan
comments.comment: As discussed,there is already a CreateActiveService Agreement method but it creates two leave plan which is not requirement of this test. I have included all Given part in private method.

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: As explained above, For getting the alignment right the tags have been used

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: Why are you using </fineos:dropdown>?

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: If we use <fineos:enum to display the dropdown, we get the framework generated info message if the subsets are updated. Here we are updated values of 3 subsets. Each time we change the values in Decision dropdown Reason dropdown is loaded with new subset values. So with enum tag each time we made change to the Decision dropdown, framework generated message was comming. So <fineos:Dropdown has been used

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Evidence result => Evidence Result Leave request => Leave Request

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: I have accepted the review comment but i feel Evidence result or Evidence Result in javadoc will have no difference. Aim ahould be Javadoc should be grammatically correct and both of them are gramatically correct.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: No, it is not only about grammar, it is about the clarity of the documentation. Evidence result => Means that result of/on Evidence. It signifies that Evidence is a thing. Evidence Result => Gives the notion of Evidence Result as an entity or a special thing in the business context.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch

There's a lot of logic going on here...

comments.author: Aisling Clinch

This is old style workspaces, you should be using TransactionManager
Moreover, why are we creating the ws here & not inside the if? Surely we wonly want to create one, when we know we're going to create the task?
